subject: MATH
title: Transitional Algebra
description: Exponents and roots; polynomials, rational radical, and absolute value expressions; factoring; linear equations and inequalities; quadratic equations; graphing; functions. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lab hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Laboratory Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1000 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: DSPM 0800 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02B 17 to 21 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 400 to 510 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 440 to 540 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( DSPM 3 to 4 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Algebra Essentials
description: 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture TN eCampus Degree Program Department

subject: MATH
title: Math for General Studies
description: Mathematics as applied to real-life problems selected from such topics as preference schemes for voting, fair division and apportionment methods, routing and scheduling problems, analysis of graphs, growth, and symmetry and counting problems. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: General Education-Math, Geometry Advanced Math Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1010 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1000 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( CM02 38 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( DSPM 4 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 19 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 460 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 500 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: MATH1010R50:Math/Liberal Arts
description: 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Regents Online Degree Program Department Restrictions: May not be assigned to one of the following Cohorts: International Cohort Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1015 General Requirements: A02 19 to 36 May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: First-Year Connections
description: This course is intended as a bridge course for students entering TTU from high school. The course is designed to strengthen the student's connection to TTU and the MATH department by focusing on the enhancement of skills needed for academic success. This course engages the student in meaningful academic and non-academic out-of-the-classroom activities, as learning occurs both in and out of the classroom. It emphasizes critical thinking, the formation of academic and social goals and support groups, and time-management and study skills. 1.000 Credit hours 1.000 Other hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Laboratory Mathematics Department Course Attributes: No Drop Allowed Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Classifications: Freshman

subject: MATH
title: College Algebra
description: 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture TN eCampus Degree Program Department

subject: MATH
title: College Algebra
description: Review of algebra and coordinate geometry; functions; polynomial, rational, exponential, and logarithmic functions; systems of equations; binomial formula; counting (multiplication principle, permutations, and combinations); and conics. Credit towards graduation will not be given for MATH 1130 and MATH 1710 or for MATH 1130 and MATH 1730. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: General Education-Math, Geometry Advanced Math Mutual Exclusion: This course carries a mutual exclusion with the following courses; you may not enroll in it if you have completed any of the following with a passing grade: MATH 1710 This course carries a mutual exclusion with the following courses; you may not enroll in it if you have completed any of the following with a passing grade: MATH 1730 Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1130 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1000 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( CM02 38 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( DSPM 4 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 19 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 460 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 500 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Number Concepts for Teachers
description: Prerequisite: Admission is restricted to students majoring in Elementary Education. Introduction to sets and operations on sets, properties and operations on whole numbers, and integers, rational and real numbers. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: Geometry Advanced Math Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Majors: Art Education Early Childhood Education Elementary Education Multidisciplinary Studies Secondary Education Special Education Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1410 General Requirements: ( CM02 38 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( DSPM 4 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 19 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 460 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 500 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Geometry Concepts for Teachers
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1410. Admission is restricted to students majoring in Elementary Education. Introduction to elements of probability and statistics and basic concepts of Euclidean geometry including congruence, similarity, measurements, areas, and volumes. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: General Education-Math Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1420 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1410 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Introductory Statistics
description: Descriptive statistics including measures of central location and variation, frequency distributions, histograms, and frequency polygons. Probability relating to elementary sample spaces, events, conditional probability, discrete and continuous type random variables, mathematical expectation, and the normal probability. Inferential statistics relating to the confidence intervals and hypothesis tests related to the mean and proportion. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: General Education-Math, Geometry Advanced Math Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1530 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1000 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( CM02 38 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( DSPM 4 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 19 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 460 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 500 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Finite Mathematics
description: 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture TN eCampus Degree Program Department

subject: MATH
title: Finite Mathematics
description: Brief review of basic algebra; introduction to probability; matrix algebra and linear programming; and applications to business and economics. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: General Education-Math, Geometry Advanced Math Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1630 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1000 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( CM02 38 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( DSPM 4 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 19 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 460 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 500 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Pre-Calculus Algebra
description: Prerequisites: ACT Math score of 22 or higher or equivalent ACCUPLACER score or C or better in MATH 1000. Review of algebra; relations and functions and their graphs, including polynomial and rational functions; conic sections; inequalities, arithmetic, and geometric sequences and series. Credit will not be given for MATH 1710 and MATH 1130 or for MATH 1710 and MATH 1730. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: General Education-Math, Geometry Advanced Math Mutual Exclusion: This course carries a mutual exclusion with the following courses; you may not enroll in it if you have completed any of the following with a passing grade: MATH 1130 This course carries a mutual exclusion with the following courses; you may not enroll in it if you have completed any of the following with a passing grade: MATH 1730 Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1710 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1000 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 22 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 520 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 540 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Pre-calculus Trigonometry
description: Prerequisites: ACT Math score of 22 or higher or equivalent ACCUPLACER score or C or better in MATH 1000. Circular functions and radian measure, graphs of the trigonometric functions, trigonometric identities, and equations, the inverse trigonometric functions, polar coordinates. Applications involving triangles, vectors in the plane and complex numbers. Credit will not be given for both MATH 1720 and MATH 1730. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: General Education-Math, Geometry Advanced Math Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1720 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1000 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 22 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 520 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 540 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Pre-Calculus Math
description: Prerequisites: ACT Math score of 25 or higher or equivalent ACCUPLACER score. Two years of high school algebra, one year of high school geometry, and 12 weeks of trigonometry. Review of algebra and trigonometry; relations and functions and their graphs, including polynomial and rational functions; conic sections; inequalities; polar coordinates; complex numbers; and advanced topics in algebra. Credit will not be given for both MATH 1730 and any of MATH 1130, MATH 1710 and MATH 1720. 5.000 Credit hours 5.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: General Education-Math, Geometry Advanced Math Mutual Exclusion: This course carries a mutual exclusion with the following courses; you may not enroll in it if you have completed any of the following with a passing grade: MATH 1130 This course carries a mutual exclusion with the following courses; you may not enroll in it if you have completed any of the following with a passing grade: MATH 1710 This course carries a mutual exclusion with the following courses; you may not enroll in it if you have completed any of the following with a passing grade: MATH 1720 Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1730 General Requirements: ( CM03 51 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 25 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 570 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 590 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Applied Calculus
description: Prerequisite: ACT mathematics score of 25 or above and three years of high school mathematics, including algebra and geometry; or, special permission of the Mathematics Department; or, C or better in MATH 1130 or MATH 1710 or equivalent. A survey of limits, continuity, and the differential and integral calculus with applications in business, economics and the life sciences. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: General Education-Math, Geometry Advanced Math Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1830 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1130 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: MATH 1710 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 25 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 570 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 590 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Further Topics/Applied Calc
description: Corequisite: MATH 1830. Includes systems of linear equations, linear programming, exponential and logarithmic equations. This course is designed to enhance students' understand of calculus and its applications to Economics. 1.000 Credit hours 1.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Corequisites: MATH 1830

subject: MATH
title: Technical Calculus
description: Prerequisite: ACT mathematics score of at least 25 and four years of high school mathematics, including algebra, geometry, trigonometry, and advanced or pre-calculus mathematics; or, special permission of the Mathematics Department; or C or better in MATH 1730; or C or better in MATH 1710 and 1720 or equivalent. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1845 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1730 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: MATH 1710 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 1720 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 25 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 570 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 590 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Calculus I
description: Prerequisite: ACT mathematics score of 27 or above and four years of high school mathematics, including algebra, geometry, trigonometry, and advanced or pre-calculus mathematics, or special permission of the Mathematics Department; or C or better in MATH 1730; or C or better in MATH 1720 and MATH 1710 or equivalent. Limits, continuity, derivatives and integrals of functions of one variable. Applications of differentiation and introduction to the definite integral. 4.000 Credit hours 4.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: General Education-Math, Geometry Advanced Math Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1910 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1710 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 1720 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: MATH 1730 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 27 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S02 610 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S12B 630 to 800 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Calculus I Honors Seminar
description: Co-requisite: Concurrent enrollment in MATH 1910. An ACT score of 30 or higher is also recommended. Selected topics to add depth to the understanding of the material in MATH 1910. Honors students can receive honors credit for MATH 1910 by successfully completing both MATH 1910 and MATH 1911. 0.000 Credit hours 1.000 Lab hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Laboratory Mathematics Department Corequisites: MATH 1910 Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1911 General Requirements: A02 30 to 36 May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Calculus II
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1910; or equivalent AP credit for MATH 1910. Integration techniques, applications of the definite integral, polar coordinates, parametric equations, sequences, and series. 4.000 Credit hours 4.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1920 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1910 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Calculus II Honors Seminar
description: Prerequisite: MATH1911 or permission of the instructor. (A grade of A in MATH 1910 is recommended for students not taking MATH 1911.) Corequisite: concurrent enrollment in MATH 1920. 0.000 Credit hours 1.000 Lab hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Laboratory Mathematics Department Corequisites: MATH 1920 Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH1921 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1911 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Introduction to Linear Algebra
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1910. Systems of linear equations, matrix algebra, inverses, matrix factorizations, determinants, vector spaces and dimension, rank, linear transformations, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, inner product, orthogonal projections. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH2010 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1910 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Calc-based Prob & Stats
description: 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture TN eCampus Degree Program Department Prerequisites: Prereq for Math2050 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1830 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: MATH 1910 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Calculus III
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1920 ; or equivalent AP credit for MATH 1910 and MATH 1920 . Analytic geometry and vectors, differential calculus of functions of several variables, multiple integration, and topics from vector calculus. 4.000 Credit hours 4.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH2110 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1920 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Differential Equations
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1920. First order equations, linear equations of higher order, power series solutions (including Frobenius method), Laplace transforms, other topics. It is recommended but not required that students take MATH 2010 before taking MATH 2120. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH2120 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1920 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Discrete Structures
description: 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH2610 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1920 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Discrete Structure & Reasoning
description: 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Regents Online Degree Program Department Restrictions: May not be assigned to one of the following Cohorts: International Cohort Prerequisites: Prequisite for MATH2810 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1910 to 1920 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 2010 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Selected Topics in Mathematics
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1920 and consent of instructor. Lectures on and discussion of topics from upper level mathematics to be selected by the instructor in a setting with less structure than in a traditional class. 1.000 Credit hours 1.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH3000 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1920 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Statistical Methods I
description: Prerequisite: ACT mathematics score greater than or equal to 19; or C or better in MATH 1130 or MATH 1710 or equivalent. Introduction to parametric statistical methods with some non-parametric alternatives, sampling, probability, Type I and Type II errors, sample size estimation, confidence interval estimation, test of hypothesis using normal, Student's t, Snedecor's F, Chi-square and the binomial distributions, linear regression, analysis of variance, and data analysis utilizing statistical software. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH3070 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1130 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: MATH 1710 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A02 19 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Statistical Methods II
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 3070. Introduction to parametric statistical methods with some non-parametric alternatives, sampling, probability, Type I and Type II errors, sample size estimation, confidence interval estimation, test of hypothesis using normal, Student's t, Snedecor's F, Chi-square and the binomial distributions, linear regression, analysis of variance, and data analysis utilizing statistical software. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH3080 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 3070 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Intro/Concepts of Math
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1920. A rigorous treatment of elements of logic and set theory including propositional calculus (statements, connectives, conditionals, and negation), quantifiers, sets and operations on sets, mappings, equivalence relations, and mathematical induction. Students are expected to work in an abstract setting using precise definitions and formal proofs. 3.000 Credit hours 4.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH3400 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1920 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: College Geometry
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 3400. A rigorous development of geometry from first concepts using the metric approach. Topics include constructions and hyperbolic geometry. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH3430 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Intro/Prob & Stats
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1920. Probability, random variables, discrete and continuous distributions and their simulation, elementary sampling theory, and estimation with an overall emphasis on simulation of random processes (Not allowed for mathematics majors after having taken MATH 4480.) 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH3470 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1920 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: College Geometry
description: 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture TN eCampus Degree Program Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH3630 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1710 to 1720 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Theory/Applics-Randam Signals
description: Introduction to randomization, unconditional and conditional probability, independence, and concepts of random variables. Distributions and density functions, moments and moment generating functions, univariate and multivariate random variables, random process concepts, spectral characteristics of random processes, and linear systems with random inputs. 2.000 Credit hours 2.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department

subject: MATH
title: Complex Variables
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 2110. Complex numbers, calculus of complex variables, analytic functions, Cauchy's Theorem, series, the Residue Theorem, and applications. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH3810 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 2110 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: MATH3810R50:College Geometry
description: 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture TN eCampus Degree Program Department Restrictions: May not be assigned to one of the following Cohorts: International Cohort Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH3815 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1910 to 1920 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Independent Study
description: Prerequisite: Consent of instructor. Readings and study under the supervision of a qualified staff member. 1.000 TO 3.000 Credit hours 1.000 TO 3.000 Other hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Independent Study Mathematics Department

subject: MATH
title: Mathematics Seminar
description: 1.000 Credit hours 1.000 Other hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Seminar TN eCampus Degree Program Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4000 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1530 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 1910 to 1920 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 2010 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 2810 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 3630 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Modern Algebra I
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 2010 or equivalent, and C or better in MATH 3400. Groups and subgroups including cyclic, abelian, finite; permutation groups; group homomorphisms; cosets and Lagrange’s Theorem; normal subgroups and factor groups. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prerequisite for MATH4010 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 2010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Modern Algebra II
description: Groups and subgroups including cyclic, abelian, finite; permutation groups, group homomorphisms, cosets and Lagrange's Theorem, normal subgroups and factor groups. Rings including integral domains, unique factorization domains and Euclidean domains, ideals and factor rings, ring homomorphisms, fields and their extensions, geometric constructions. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prequisite for MATH4020 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 4010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Number Theory
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 3400 or consent of instructor. Properties of integers, division algorithms, prime numbers, diophantine equations, and congruences. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4050 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Topics in Cryptography
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 2010 and C or better in either MATH 3400 or CSC 2700. Fundamental concepts of cryptography presented with mathematical background (including groups, fields, elements of number theory, probability and statistics). Special attention will be given to the RSA algorithm, Elliptic Curve Cryptography, the EIGamal public key cryptosystem, Diffie-Hellman key exchange and pseudo random number generators. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4060 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 2010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: CSC 2700 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Advanced Calculus I
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4110 (5110): C or better in MATH 3400 or consent of instructor; MATH 4120 (5120): C or better in MATH 4110 (5110). Rigorous treatment of functions of one and several variables, improper integrals, sequences, infinite series, uniform convergence, and applications. Students are expected to improve their ability to work in an abstract setting using precise definitions and formal proofs and to present their work in class. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4110 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Advanced Calculus II
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4110 (5110): C or better in MATH 3400 or consent of instructor; MATH 4120 (5120): C or better in MATH 4110 (5110). Rigorous treatment of functions of one and several variables, improper integrals, sequences, infinite series, uniform convergence, and applications. Students are expected to improve their ability to work in an abstract setting using precise definitions and formal proofs and to present their work in class. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4120 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 4110 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Numerical Analysis I
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4210 (5210): C or better in MATH 1920; MATH 4220 (5220): C or better in MATH 2120 or consent of instructor. Iterative methods for nonlinear equations, computational error analysis, convergence of iterative techniques, interpolation, numerical differentiation and integration, approximate solutions of initial-value problems, boundary-value problems, and nonlinear systems, and direct and iterative methods for linear systems. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4210 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1920 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Numerical Analysis II
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4210 (5210): C or better in MATH 1920; MATH 4220 (5220): C or better in MATH 2120 or consent of instructor. Iterative methods for nonlinear equations, computational error analysis, convergence of iterative techniques, interpolation, numerical differentiation and integration, approximate solutions of initial-value problems, boundary-value problems, and nonlinear systems, and direct and iterative methods for linear systems. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4220 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 2120 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Adv Ord Diff Equations I
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4250 (5250): C or better in MATH 2110 and MATH 2120; MATH 4260 (5260): C or better in MATH 4250 (5250). Systems of ordinary differential equations, matrix methods, approximate solutions, stability theory, basic theory of nonlinear equations and differential systems, trajectories, phase space stability, and construction of liapunov functions. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4250 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 2110 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 2120 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Adv Ord Diff Equations II
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4250 (5250): C or better in MATH 2110 and MATH 2120; MATH 4260 (5260): C or better in MATH 4250 (5250). Systems of ordinary differential equations, matrix methods, approximate solutions, stability theory, basic theory of nonlinear equations and differential systems, trajectories, phase space stability, and construction of liapunov functions. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4260 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 4250 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Intro to Topology I
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4310 (5310): C or better in MATH 3400; MATH 4320 (5320): C or better in MATH 4310 (5310). Topological spaces, continuity, connectedness, compactness, separation axioms, function spaces, and fundamental groups. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4310 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Intro to Topology II
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4310 (5310): C or better in MATH 3400; MATH 4320 (5320): C or better in MATH 4310 (5310). Topological spaces, continuity, connectedness, compactness, separation axioms, function spaces, and fundamental groups. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4320 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 4310 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Introductory Combinatorics
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 3400 or consent of instructor. Topics to be covered include permutations, combinations, multisets, partitions, recurrence relations, generating functions, and the principle of inclusion-exclusion. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4350 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Graph Theory
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 3400 or consent of instructor. Fundamental concepts of undirected and directed graphs, trees, connectivity, traversability, colorability, network flows, and matching theory. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4360 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Differential Geometry
description: Prerequisites: C or better in MATH 2110, 2010 and 3400. Geometry of curves and surfaces in three dimensional space. Calculus on surfaces, curvature and Riemannian geometry. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4410 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 2010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 2110 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Probability & Statistics I
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4470: C or better in MATH 2110; MATH 4480: C or better in MATH 4470. Mathematical foundations of elementary statistical methods, application and theory, probability in discrete and continuous distribution, correlation and regression, sampling distributions, and significance tests. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4470 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 2110 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Probability & Statistics II
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4470: C or better in MATH 2110; MATH 4480: C or better in MATH 4470. Mathematical foundations of elementary statistical methods, application and theory, probability in discrete and continuous distribution, correlation and regression, sampling distributions, and significance tests. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4480 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 4470 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Adv Math for Engineers
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 2110 and MATH 2120. Fourier series, Sturm-Liouville problems, orthogonal functions, Legendre polynomials, Bessel functions, separable partial differential equations (e.g. heat, wave and Laplace equations), and other topics. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4510 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 2110 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 2120 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Linear Algebra I
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4530 (5530): C or better in MATH 2010 and MATH 3400; MATH 4540 (5540): C or better in MATH 4530 (5530). A theoretical study of vector spaces, bases and dimensions, subspaces, linear transformations, dual spaces, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, inner product spaces, spectral theory, duality, and quadratic and bilinear forms. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4530 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 2010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Linear Algebra II
description: Prerequisite: MATH 4530 (5530): C or better in MATH 2010 and MATH 3400; MATH 4540 (5540): C or better in MATH 4530 (5530). A theoretical study of vector spaces, bases and dimensions, subspaces, linear transformations, dual spaces, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, inner product spaces, spectral theory, duality, and quadratic and bilinear forms. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4540 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 4530 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematics of Investment I
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1920 or consent of instructor. Topics include examination of annuities, loans, bonds and other securities, portfolio, immunization, interest rate swaps. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH 4550 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 1920 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Mathematics of Investment II
description: Prerequisite: C or better in both MATH 4550/5550 and MATH 4470/5470, or consent of instructor. Topics include derivative securities, mathematical models of financial risk management, and corporate finance. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4560 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 4470 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 4550 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: History of Mathematics I
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 3400. The development of mathematics and its relation to the development of civilization prior to the beginnings of calculus. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4610 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: History of Mathematics II
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 3400. History of mathematics from the beginnings of calculus through the modern times. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4620 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Vector Analysis
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 2110. The algebra and the differential and integral calculus of vectors, and applications to geometry and mechanics. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4710 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 2110 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Category Theory of Sets
description: Prerequisites: C or better in MATH 3400 (or consent of instructor for MATH 5750). Abstract sets and mappings, categories, sums, universal property, monomorphisms and parts, finite inverse limits, colimits, epimorphisms, the Axiom of Choice, mapping sets and exponentials, covariant and contravariant functoriality of function spaces, Cantor's diagonal argument, powers sets, variable sets, models of additional variation, and selected applications. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4750 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Comp Algebraic Geometry I
description: Prerequisites: C or better in MATH 2010 and C or better in MATH 3400 or equivalent (or consent of instructor for MATH 5850). Additional recommended prerequisite: MATH 3510 or any other 4000/5000 level mathematics course in which proofs are required. Affine varieties and polynomial ideals, Groebner bases, elimination theory, Hilbert¿s Nullstellensatz, Zariski closure, and decomposition into irreducible varieties. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4850 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: MATH 2010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: MATH 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: MATH
title: Comp Algebraic Geometry II
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 4850 (5850). Polynomial and rational functions on a variety, projective varieties, the dimension of a variety, selected applications in robotics, automatic theorem proving, and invariant theory of finite groups. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4860 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 4850 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Directed Readings
description: Prerequisite: Consent of instructor. These courses provide an opportunity for individual reading and study under the supervision of a qualified staff member. 1.000 TO 3.000 Credit hours 1.000 TO 3.000 Other hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Independent Study Mathematics Department

subject: MATH
title: Directed Readings
description: Prerequisite: Consent of instructor. These courses provide an opportunity for individual reading and study under the supervision of a qualified staff member. 1.000 TO 3.000 Credit hours 1.000 TO 3.000 Other hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Independent Study Mathematics Department

subject: MATH
title: Topics in Mathematics
description: Prerequisite: Consent of instructor. A formal course in any area where there is no other course offering. May be taken more than once provided that the topic is different. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Other hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Independent Study Mathematics Department

subject: MATH
title: Senior Seminar
description: Prerequisite: Senior standing. Preparation of papers at an advanced level in mathematics to be presented both in writing and orally. 1.000 Credit hours 1.000 Other hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Seminar Mathematics Department Restrictions: May not be enrolled as the following Classifications: Undergraduate Special Sophomore Freshman Junior

subject: MATH
title: Mathematical Research
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1920 and consent of instructor. This course introduces students to the process of performing research. By reading papers the students will learn how to define open and significant problems, set up a research plan and, if applicable, define relevant experiments. Students will be required to give presentations on either their own or other people's research. These courses can be taken for credit more than once. 1.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: Undergraduate Research 1 Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4991 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1920 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematical Research
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1920 and consent of instructor. This course introduces students to the process of performing research. By reading papers the students will learn how to define open and significant problems, set up a research plan and, if applicable, define relevant experiments. Students will be required to give presentations on either their own or other people's research. These courses can be taken for credit more than once. 2.000 Credit hours 2.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: Undergraduate Research 1 Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4992 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1920 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.

subject: MATH
title: Mathematical Research
description: Prerequisite: C or better in MATH 1920 and consent of instructor. This course introduces students to the process of performing research. By reading papers the students will learn how to define open and significant problems, set up a research plan and, if applicable, define relevant experiments. Students will be required to give presentations on either their own or other people's research. These courses can be taken for credit more than once. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture Mathematics Department Course Attributes: Undergraduate Research 1 Prerequisites: Prereq for MATH4993 General Requirements: Course or Test: MATH 1920 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently.
